course.title: The Masquerade of Common Scents: An Exploration of Ephemeral Knowledge
course.description: Intimate, subjective and transitory, the sense of smell has the power to evoke memory and emotions, to mark places and persons, and give rise to both desire and disgust. Lacking a well-defined vocabulary, smell can be elusive. Yet, as evidence of disease, crime, gender, race, sexuality, the sacred and profane, scent lingers on in judgment. How does this verdict coalesce - in medicine, public health and law? We will sample various scents and use them as the occasion for writing and reflection -- shared and yet privately known, these olfactory forays will serve as our experience of an impossibly common sense.
